article:
Hurricane Ian

Hurricane Ian was a powerful and destructive Category 5 hurricane that caused catastrophic damage and loss of life in the Caribbean and the southeastern United States in September 2022. The storm formed in the Caribbean Sea and intensified rapidly, becoming one of the strongest hurricanes to affect the region in recent history.

#Meteorological history

Hurricane Ian formed on September 23, 2022, from a tropical wave that had been moving westward across the Caribbean Sea. The system gradually organized, and by September 24, it had developed into a tropical depression. The depression strengthened into a tropical storm later that day, and was given the name Ian. Ian continued to intensify, becoming a hurricane on September 25. The storm then underwent rapid intensification, reaching Category 5 strength on September 26. Ian's winds peaked at 165 mph (270 km/h), making it one of the strongest hurricanes to affect the Caribbean in recent history. The storm maintained its Category 5 strength for several hours before beginning to weaken.

#Preparations

As Ian approached the Caribbean, governments and emergency management officials took steps to prepare for the storm's impact.

##Caribbean

###Jamaica

The Jamaican government issued a hurricane warning for the entire island, and residents were advised to seek shelter immediately. Schools and businesses were closed, and public transportation was suspended. The government also activated its National Emergency Operations Centre to coordinate relief efforts.

###Cayman Islands

The Cayman Islands government issued a hurricane warning for Grand Cayman and the Sister Islands. Residents were advised to seek shelter in a safe location, and all non-essential travel was banned. The government also activated its National Emergency Operations Centre to coordinate relief efforts.

###Cuba

The Cuban government issued a hurricane warning for the western provinces of Pinar del Río and Artemisa. Residents in low-lying areas were evacuated to higher ground, and all non-essential travel was banned. The government also activated its National Emergency Operations Centre to coordinate relief efforts.

##United States

As Ian approached the southeastern United States, governments and emergency management officials took steps to prepare for the storm's impact.

###Florida

The Florida government issued a state of emergency for the entire state, and residents were advised to seek shelter immediately. Schools and businesses were closed, and public transportation was suspended. The government also activated its National Emergency Operations Centre to coordinate relief efforts.

###Georgia

The Georgia government issued a state of emergency for the coastal regions, and residents were advised to seek shelter immediately. Schools and businesses were closed, and public transportation was suspended. The government also activated its National Emergency Operations Centre to coordinate relief efforts.

###South Carolina

The South Carolina government issued a state of emergency for the coastal regions, and residents were advised to seek shelter immediately. Schools and businesses were closed, and public transportation was suspended. The government also activated its National Emergency Operations Centre to coordinate relief efforts.

###Elsewhere

Other states in the southeastern United States, including North Carolina, Virginia, and Tennessee, also issued states of emergency and took steps to prepare for the storm's impact.

##The Bahamas

The Bahamian government issued a hurricane warning for the southern islands, and residents were advised to seek shelter immediately. Schools and businesses were closed, and public transportation was suspended. The government also activated its National Emergency Operations Centre to coordinate relief efforts.

#Impact

Hurricane Ian caused catastrophic damage and loss of life in the Caribbean and the southeastern United States.

##Caribbean

###Southern Caribbean and South America

Ian's outer rainbands brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to the southern Caribbean and northern South America. Several countries, including Trinidad and Tobago, Guyana, and Suriname, reported significant damage and flooding.

###Cayman Islands

Ian made landfall on Grand Cayman on September 26, bringing with it catastrophic winds and storm surge. The storm caused widespread destruction, including damage to homes, businesses, and infrastructure. Several people were reported killed, and many more were injured.

###Cuba

Ian made landfall on the western coast of Cuba on September 27, bringing with it strong winds and heavy rainfall. The storm caused significant damage, including power outages and flooding. Several people were reported killed, and many more were injured.

##United States

###Florida

Ian made landfall on the southwestern coast of Florida on September 28, bringing with it catastrophic winds and storm surge. The storm caused widespread destruction, including damage to homes, businesses, and infrastructure. Several people were reported killed, and many more were injured.

###The Carolinas

Ian brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to the Carolinas, causing significant damage and flooding. Several people were reported killed, and many more were injured.

###Elsewhere

Other states in the southeastern United States, including Georgia, Virginia, and Tennessee, also reported significant damage and flooding from Ian.

#Aftermath

The aftermath of Hurricane Ian was marked by widespread destruction and loss of life in the Caribbean and the southeastern United States.

##Cuba

The Cuban government reported that Ian had caused over $1 billion in damages, making it one of the costliest hurricanes in the country's history. The government also reported that several people had been killed, and many more were injured.

##United States

The U.S. government reported that Ian had caused over $50 billion in damages, making it one of the costliest hurricanes in U.S. history. The government also reported that several people had been killed, and many more were injured.

###Damage estimates

The damage estimates from Hurricane Ian were staggering, with some estimates suggesting that the storm had caused over $100 billion in damages. The storm had also caused widespread power outages, with over 1 million people left without electricity.

#Depiction in media

Hurricane Ian was widely covered in the media, with many news outlets providing live coverage of the storm's impact. The storm was also the subject of several documentaries and news specials.

#Retirement

Due to the severity of the damage and loss of life caused by Hurricane Ian, the name "Ian" was retired from the list of Atlantic hurricane names in 2023.

#See also

* List of Category 5 Atlantic hurricanes
* List of costliest Atlantic hurricanes
* List of deadliest Atlantic hurricanes

#Notes

* This article is based on information available up to September 2022 and may not reflect subsequent updates or changes.

#External links

* National Hurricane Center: Hurricane Ian
* National Weather Service: Hurricane Ian
* Federal Emergency Management Agency: Hurricane Ian

Nigerien Crisis (2023–2024)

The Nigerien crisis is an ongoing political and security crisis in Niger that began in July 2023. The crisis is characterized by a military coup that overthrew the democratically elected government, followed by a series of events that have led to a severe deterioration of the security situation in the country.

# Background

## ECOWAS

The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) has played a significant role in the crisis. ECOWAS is a regional economic community that aims to promote economic integration and cooperation among its member states. Niger is a member of ECOWAS, and the organization has been involved in efforts to resolve the crisis.

## Security Situation

The security situation in Niger has been deteriorating for several years, with the country facing threats from armed groups, including Boko Haram and the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS). The country has also been affected by the Sahel conflict, which has led to a significant increase in violence and instability in the region.

# Timeline

## July

### 29 July

The crisis began on July 29, 2023, when a group of military officers announced that they had seized power in a coup. The officers, who called themselves the National Council for the Safeguard of the Homeland (CNSP), said that they had taken control of the government and the country's institutions.

### 30 July

#### ECOWAS Ultimatum and Sanctions

On July 30, 2023, ECOWAS issued an ultimatum to the CNSP, demanding that they restore the democratically elected government within 15 days. ECOWAS also imposed sanctions on Niger, including the closure of the country's borders and the suspension of all economic and financial transactions.

#### Pro-Coup Demonstrations in Niamey

Despite the ECOWAS ultimatum, thousands of people took to the streets in Niamey, the capital city of Niger, to demonstrate in support of the CNSP. The protesters, who were largely made up of young people, chanted slogans in support of the military and called for the departure of the ousted president.

### 31 July

The CNSP announced the establishment of a new government, with a military officer as the head of state. The new government promised to hold elections within a year and to restore stability and security in the country.

### 2 August

The CNSP announced that it would not restore the ousted president, but would instead establish a new government that would include representatives from all regions of the country.

### 3 August

Thousands of people took to the streets in Niamey to demonstrate against the CNSP. The protesters, who were largely made up of opposition supporters, chanted slogans calling for the restoration of the democratically elected government.

article:
2023 European Athletics Team Championships
=====================================

The 2023 European Athletics Team Championships is the 37th edition of the European Athletics Team Championships, an annual athletics competition for European countries. This year's event features a new format, with the top-tier First Division being held in conjunction with the 2023 European Games in Chorzów, Poland.

Format change
-------------

For the first time in the history of the European Athletics Team Championships, the top-tier First Division will be held in conjunction with the European Games. This change aims to increase the profile of the event and provide a more competitive environment for the top European athletics nations. The Second and Third Divisions will maintain their traditional format, with teams competing in a separate event.

Schedule
--------

### Calendar

The 2023 European Athletics Team Championships will take place from June 20 to June 25, 2023, in Chorzów, Poland (First Division) and three other locations for the Second and Third Divisions.

Medal table
------------

The medal table will be updated after the conclusion of the championships.

2023 European Games individual medalists

article:
Everything Everywhere All at Once
=====================================

Everything Everywhere All at Once is a 2022 American absurdist science fiction film written and directed by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, collectively known as the Daniels. The film stars Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan, Jenny Slate, Harry Shum Jr., and Jamie Lee Curtis. It follows the story of a Chinese-American woman who discovers she can access parallel universes and must use this ability to prevent a catastrophic event that threatens the multiverse.

Plot
-----

The film centers around Evelyn Wang (Michelle Yeoh), a middle-aged Chinese-American woman who runs a laundromat with her husband, Waymond (Ke Huy Quan). The couple is being audited by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), and Evelyn is struggling to balance her business and personal life. During an audit meeting, Evelyn is suddenly thrust into a multiverse, where she begins to access parallel universes and alternate versions of herself.

As Evelyn navigates these different universes, she discovers that she has the ability to "verse-jump" and access the skills and memories of her alternate selves. She soon learns that a rogue entity, known as "Jobu Tupaki," is threatening the multiverse, and she must use her newfound abilities to stop it.

Along the way, Evelyn encounters a variety of alternate versions of herself, including a universe where she is a famous actress, a universe where she is a skilled martial artist, and a universe where she is a successful businesswoman. As she jumps between these different universes, Evelyn must confront her own regrets and disappointments, and learn to accept herself for who she is.

Cast
-----

* Michelle Yeoh as Evelyn Wang
* Ke Huy Quan as Waymond Wang
* Jenny Slate as Big Nose
* Harry Shum Jr. as Chad
* Jamie Lee Curtis as Deirdre Beaubeirdre
* Stephanie Hsu as Joy Wang / Jobu Tupaki
* Tallie Medel as Becky

Production
------------

### Development

The idea for Everything Everywhere All at Once was first conceived by the Daniels in 2016. The duo had previously worked together on the film Swiss Army Man, and were looking to create a new project that would explore themes of identity, love, and the multiverse.

The script was written over a period of several years, with the Daniels drawing inspiration from a variety of sources, including the works of Taoist philosopher Zhuangzi, the film Rashomon, and the TV show Rick and Morty.

### Casting

Michelle Yeoh was the first actor to be cast in the film, with the Daniels specifically writing the role of Evelyn Wang with her in mind. Ke Huy Quan, who had previously appeared in the film Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, was cast as Waymond Wang, Evelyn's husband.

Jenny Slate, Harry Shum Jr., and Jamie Lee Curtis were also cast in supporting roles, with Stephanie Hsu playing the dual role of Joy Wang and Jobu Tupaki.

### Filming

Principal photography on the film began in January 2020 and lasted for approximately 38 days. The film was shot on location in Los Angeles and San Fernando Valley, with the Daniels using a combination of digital and film cameras to capture the film's unique visual style.

The film's action sequences were choreographed by Andy Le and Brian Le, with the Daniels drawing inspiration from a variety of martial arts films, including the works of Jackie Chan and Sammo Hung.

### Visual effects

The film's visual effects were created by the company GloWormFX, with the Daniels working closely with the visual effects team to create the film's unique and innovative visual effects.

The film's visual effects include a variety of innovative techniques, such as the use of "verse-jumping" to move between different universes, and the creation of a variety of alternate versions of the film's characters.

Themes
--------

Everything Everywhere All at Once is a film that explores a variety of themes, including identity, love, and the multiverse. The film's use of the multiverse as a metaphor for the complexities of human identity is a central theme, with the film's protagonist, Evelyn Wang, navigating a variety of different universes and alternate versions of herself.

The film also explores the theme of love, with Evelyn's relationship with her husband, Waymond, serving as a central plot point. The film's use of the multiverse as a metaphor for the complexities of human relationships is a key theme, with the film's protagonist navigating a variety of different relationships and alternate versions of herself.

Music
------

The film's score was composed by Son Lux, with the Daniels working closely with the composer to create a unique and innovative score that incorporates a variety of different musical styles.

The film's score includes a variety of innovative techniques, such as the use of found sounds and field recordings to create the film's unique sound design.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Everything Everywhere All at Once was released in theaters on March 25, 2022, by A24. The film received a limited release, playing in approximately 10 theaters in the United States.

The film received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's unique visual style, innovative action sequences, and strong performances from the cast.

### Home media

The film was released on home media on May 17, 2022, by A24. The film was released on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital formats, with the Blu-ray release including a variety of special features, including deleted scenes, behind-the-scenes footage, and a commentary track with the Daniels.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Everything Everywhere All at Once was a commercial success, grossing over $23 million at the domestic box office and over $40 million worldwide.

The film's success was driven by positive word-of-mouth, with many audiences praising the film's unique visual style, innovative action sequences, and strong performances from the cast.

### Critical response

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's unique visual style, innovative action sequences, and strong performances from the cast.

The film holds a 95% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the film's innovative storytelling, unique visual style, and strong performances from the cast.

### Legacy

Everything Everywhere All at Once has been recognized as a landmark film in the science fiction genre, with many praising the film's innovative storytelling, unique visual style, and strong performances from the cast.

The film's influence can be seen in a variety of other films and TV shows, including the TV show Rick and Morty, which has referenced the film's unique visual style and innovative storytelling.

### Accolades

Everything Everywhere All at Once has received a variety of awards and nominations, including the Academy Award for Best Actress for Michelle Yeoh's performance.

The film has also been recognized by a variety of film critics associations, including the National Board of Review and the Critics' Choice Movie Awards.

article:
Elon Musk

Elon Musk is a South African-born entrepreneur, inventor, and business magnate. He is best known for his ambitious goals in revolutionizing transportation, energy, and space exploration through his companies Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, and The Boring Company. Musk's vision for the future has captivated the attention of the world, and his innovative ideas have made him one of the most influential figures in modern technology.

# Early life and education

## Childhood and family

Elon Musk was born on June 28, 1971, in Pretoria, South Africa. His mother, Maye Musk, was a Canadian-born dietitian, and his father, Errol Musk, was an engineer and entrepreneur. Musk's parents divorced when he was 10 years old, and he spent most of his childhood with his father in Pretoria. Musk has two younger siblings, Kimbal and Tosca.

## Education

Musk developed an interest in computing and programming at an early age and taught himself computer programming. He attended Pretoria University High School and was an introverted child who was often bullied by his classmates. Musk moved to Canada in 1992 to attend college, and later transferred to the University of Pennsylvania, where he graduated with a degree in economics and physics in 1997.

# Business career

## Zip2

After college, Musk moved to California to pursue a career in technology and entrepreneurship. In 1995, he co-founded Zip2, a company that provided online content publishing software for news organizations. Musk served as the company's CEO until it was acquired by Compaq in 1999 for $307 million.

## X.com and PayPal

In 1999, Musk co-founded X.com, which later became PayPal, an online payment system that was acquired by eBay for $1.5 billion in 2002. Musk served as the company's CEO until it was acquired, and he made a significant amount of money from the sale.

## SpaceX

In 2002, Musk founded SpaceX, a private space exploration company with the goal of reducing space transportation costs and enabling the colonization of Mars. SpaceX has developed several advanced rockets, including the Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy, and has successfully launched numerous satellites and spacecraft into orbit. The company has also developed the Dragon spacecraft, which has carried cargo and crew to the International Space Station.

### Starlink

In 2019, SpaceX launched its Starlink satellite constellation, a network of low-Earth orbit satellites that provide high-speed internet connectivity to remote and underserved areas. The project aims to generate revenue for SpaceX and help fund its ambitious goals for space exploration.

## Tesla

In 2004, Musk co-founded Tesla, Inc., an electric vehicle and clean energy company. Tesla has become one of the leading electric vehicle manufacturers in the world, with a market capitalization of over $100 billion. The company has developed several successful models, including the Model S, Model X, and Model 3, and has expanded its product line to include energy storage and solar panels.

### SEC and shareholder lawsuits regarding tweets

In 2018, Musk faced criticism and lawsuits from the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Tesla shareholders over his tweets, which were seen as potentially misleading and affecting the company's stock price. Musk agreed to settle the SEC lawsuit by paying a $20 million fine and stepping down as Tesla's chairman.

### SolarCity and Tesla Energy

In 2016, Tesla acquired SolarCity, a solar panel manufacturing company co-founded by Musk. The acquisition expanded Tesla's product line to include solar energy solutions, and the company has since developed several innovative products, including the Solar Roof and Powerwall energy storage system.

## Neuralink

In 2016, Musk co-founded Neuralink, a neurotechnology company that aims to integrate the human brain with computers. The company is developing implantable brain–machine interfaces (BMIs) that could potentially treat a wide range of medical conditions, including paralysis and depression.

## The Boring Company

In 2016, Musk founded The Boring Company, a tunnel construction company that aims to reduce traffic congestion in cities by building underground tunnels for high-speed transportation. The company has developed several innovative technologies, including electric skates and tunnel boring machines.

## Twitter / X

In 2022, Musk acquired Twitter, a social media platform, and rebranded it as X. He has stated that he plans to improve the platform's free speech policies and reduce its reliance on advertising revenue.

## Leadership style

Musk is known for his demanding leadership style, which has been described as intense and often brutal. He has been criticized for his treatment of employees, and several high-profile executives have left his companies due to disagreements with his management style.

# Other activities

## Musk Foundation

In 2002, Musk established the Musk Foundation, a non-profit organization that provides scholarships and grants to support education and renewable energy projects. The foundation has donated millions of dollars to various causes, including the Cleantech Open and the Sierra Club.

## Hyperloop

In 2013, Musk proposed the Hyperloop, a high-speed transportation system that would use vacuum-sealed tubes and magnetic levitation to propel vehicles at speeds of up to 700 mph (1,127 km/h). The project has been developed by several companies, including Virgin Hyperloop One and Hyperloop Transportation Technologies.

## OpenAI and xAI

In 2015, Musk co-founded OpenAI, a non-profit artificial intelligence research organization that aims to develop safe and transparent AI technologies. He has also invested in xAI, a for-profit AI company that aims to develop AI-powered solutions for businesses.

## Tham Luang cave rescue and defamation case

In 2018, Musk played a role in the rescue of a Thai soccer team trapped in a cave, providing equipment and expertise to the rescue effort. However, he also faced criticism and a defamation lawsuit from a British cave diver, Vernon Unsworth, who claimed that Musk had made false and damaging statements about him on Twitter.

## 2018 cannabis incident

In 2018, Musk faced criticism and a SEC investigation after he smoked cannabis during a live podcast, which caused Tesla's stock price to decline.

## Music

Musk has released several music tracks, including a rap song called "Don't Doubt Ur Vibe" and a synth-pop song called "Test Drive Patsy".

## Private jet

Musk owns a Gulfstream G650ER private jet, which he uses for business and personal travel.

## Company towns

Musk has proposed the idea of company towns, where employees would live and work in self-sustaining communities developed by his companies. However, the idea has faced criticism and skepticism from experts and local communities.

# Wealth

Musk's net worth is estimated to be over $200 billion, making him one of the richest people in the world. He has made his fortune through his successful companies, including Tesla, SpaceX, and PayPal.

# Personal actions, views, and social media usage

## Finance

Musk has been critical of the financial industry and has advocated for the use of cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin. He has also been a vocal supporter of the "degrowth" movement, which advocates for reducing economic growth to address environmental and social issues.

## Technology

Musk has been a proponent of advanced technologies, including artificial intelligence, renewable energy, and biotechnology. He has also been a critic of social media platforms, which he believes have a negative impact on society.

## Existential threats

Musk has warned about the risks of existential threats, including climate change, nuclear war, and artificial intelligence. He has advocated for the development of sustainable energy solutions and the colonization of Mars to ensure the survival of humanity.

## Politics

Musk has been critical of politics and has advocated for a more direct form of democracy, where citizens can vote on policies and laws directly. He has also been a supporter of the Libertarian Party and has donated to several libertarian politicians.

### Conservative PAC activities

In 2022, Musk was accused of secretly funding a conservative PAC, which was used to support Republican candidates in the midterm elections.

### International politics

Musk has been involved in several international controversies, including a dispute with the Chinese government over Tesla's business practices in China. He has also been critical of the Russian government's actions in Ukraine.

## Accusations of antisemitism

Musk has faced accusations of antisemitism due to his criticism of the Israeli government's treatment of Palestinians. However, he has denied being antisemitic and has stated that he is a supporter of Israel.

## COVID-19

Musk has been a vocal critic of the COVID-19 lockdowns and has advocated for the use of alternative treatments, such as ivermectin. However, his views on the pandemic have been widely criticized by experts and have been seen as potentially misleading.

# Personal life

## Relationships and children

Musk has been married three times and has seven children. His first wife was Justine Musk, a Canadian author, and his second wife was Talulah Riley, a British actress. His third wife was Claire Boucher, a Canadian musician.

## Legal matters after 2020

Musk has faced several legal challenges, including a defamation lawsuit from a Twitter user who claimed that Musk had made false statements about them. He has also faced criticism and lawsuits from Tesla shareholders and employees.

# Public perception

Musk's public perception is highly polarized, with some people viewing him as a visionary and a pioneer, while others see him as a divisive figure who is reckless and irresponsible. His leadership style and his use of social media have been widely criticized, and he has faced several controversies and lawsuits throughout his career.

# Notes and references

## Notes

This article is a general overview of Elon Musk's life and career and is not intended to be a comprehensive or definitive biography.

## Citations

article:
2022 Pakistan Super League

The 2022 Pakistan Super League was the seventh season of the Pakistan Super League, a professional Twenty20 cricket league established by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB). The season took place from 27 January to 27 February 2022. The tournament featured six teams, with the final match played at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore.

# Squads

The six teams that competed in the 2022 Pakistan Super League were:

* Islamabad United: captained by Shadab Khan
* Karachi Kings: captained by Imad Wasim
* Lahore Qalandars: captained by Shaheen Afridi
* Multan Sultans: captained by Mohammad Rizwan
* Peshawar Zalmi: captained by Wahab Riaz
* Quetta Gladiators: captained by Sarfaraz Ahmed

Each team was allowed to select a maximum of 18 players, with a minimum of two emerging players.

# Venues

The 2022 Pakistan Super League was played at two venues:

* National Stadium, Karachi ( Karachi leg)
* Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore ( Lahore leg)

The National Stadium in Karachi hosted 15 matches, while the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore hosted 19 matches, including the playoffs and final.

# COVID-19 protocols

The 2022 Pakistan Super League was played under strict COVID-19 protocols. Players, officials, and support staff were required to undergo regular testing and adhere to social distancing measures. Spectators were also required to follow COVID-19 protocols, including wearing masks and maintaining social distancing.

# Match officials

## Umpires

The 2022 Pakistan Super League featured a panel of experienced umpires, including:

* Aleem Dar
* Ahsan Raza
* Asif Yaqoob
* Faisal Afridi
* Imran Javed
* Rashid Riaz
* Shozab Raza
* Waleed Yaqub

## Referees

The 2022 Pakistan Super League featured a panel of experienced referees, including:

* Mohammad Anees
* Mohammad Aslam
* Mohammad Javed
* Roshan Mahanama

# Marketing

## Broadcast rights

The 2022 Pakistan Super League was broadcast in Pakistan by PTV Sports and Geo Super. Internationally, the tournament was broadcast by various networks, including Sky Sports in the United Kingdom, Fox Sports in Australia, and Willow TV in the United States.

## Anthem and curtain raiser

The 2022 Pakistan Super League featured an anthem titled "Agay Dekh", performed by Atif Aslam and Aima Baig. The curtain raiser was performed by Atif Aslam, Aima Baig, and Abdullah Qureshi.

## Media personnel

The 2022 Pakistan Super League featured a team of experienced media personnel, including commentators, presenters, and analysts.

## Curtain closer

The 2022 Pakistan Super League featured a curtain closer performance by Atif Aslam and Aima Baig.

# League stage

## Format

The 2022 Pakistan Super League featured a double round-robin format, with each team playing 10 matches. The top four teams qualified for the playoffs.

## Points table

The points table for the 2022 Pakistan Super League was as follows:

| Team | Matches | Won | Lost | No result | Points |
| Multan Sultans | 10 | 9 | 1 | 0 | 18 |
| Lahore Qalandars | 10 | 7 | 3 | 0 | 14 |
| Peshawar Zalmi | 10 | 6 | 4 | 0 | 12 |
| Islamabad United | 10 | 4 | 6 | 0 | 8 |
| Karachi Kings | 10 | 4 | 6 | 0 | 8 |
| Quetta Gladiators | 10 | 2 | 8 | 0 | 4 |

## Summary

The league stage of the 2022 Pakistan Super League was dominated by the Multan Sultans, who won nine of their 10 matches. The Lahore Qalandars finished second, with the Peshawar Zalmi finishing third.

## League progression

The league progression of the 2022 Pakistan Super League was as follows:

* Week 1: Multan Sultans won three matches, while Lahore Qalandars won two.
* Week 2: Multan Sultans won two matches, while Peshawar Zalmi won two.
* Week 3: Multan Sultans won two matches, while Lahore Qalandars won two.
* Week 4: Multan Sultans won two matches, while Peshawar Zalmi won two.

# Fixtures

## Karachi

The Karachi leg of the 2022 Pakistan Super League featured 15 matches, played from 27 January to 7 February.

## Lahore

The Lahore leg of the 2022 Pakistan Super League featured 19 matches, played from 10 February to 27 February.

## Summary

The 2022 Pakistan Super League featured a total of 34 matches, played over 32 days.

### Week 1

* Match 1: Karachi Kings vs. Multan Sultans (Karachi)
* Match 2: Lahore Qalandars vs. Peshawar Zalmi (Karachi)
* Match 3: Islamabad United vs. Quetta Gladiators (Karachi)
* Match 4: Karachi Kings vs. Lahore Qalandars (Karachi)
* Match 5: Multan Sultans vs. Peshawar Zalmi (Karachi)

### Week 2

* Match 6: Islamabad United vs. Karachi Kings (Karachi)
* Match 7: Quetta Gladiators vs. Lahore Qalandars (Karachi)
* Match 8: Multan Sultans vs. Islamabad United (Karachi)
* Match 9: Peshawar Zalmi vs. Quetta Gladiators (Karachi)
* Match 10: Karachi Kings vs. Peshawar Zalmi (Karachi)

### Week 3

* Match 11: Lahore Qalandars vs. Multan Sultans (Lahore)
* Match 12: Islamabad United vs. Lahore Qalandars (Lahore)
* Match 13: Quetta Gladiators vs. Karachi Kings (Lahore)
* Match 14: Peshawar Zalmi vs. Islamabad United (Lahore)
* Match 15: Multan Sultans vs. Quetta Gladiators (Lahore)

### Week 4

* Match 16: Karachi Kings vs. Islamabad United (Lahore)
* Match 17: Lahore Qalandars vs. Quetta Gladiators (Lahore)
* Match 18: Peshawar Zalmi vs. Multan Sultans (Lahore)
* Match 19: Karachi Kings vs. Quetta Gladiators (Lahore)
* Match 20: Lahore Qalandars vs. Islamabad United (Lahore)

# Playoffs

## Qualifier

The Qualifier was played between the top two teams in the points table, Multan Sultans and Lahore Qalandars. Multan Sultans won the match by 28 runs.

## Eliminators

### Eliminator 1

Eliminator 1 was played between the third-placed team, Peshawar Zalmi, and the fourth-placed team, Islamabad United. Peshawar Zalmi won the match by 5 wickets.

### Eliminator 2

Eliminator 2 was played between the loser of the Qualifier, Lahore Qalandars, and the winner of Eliminator 1, Peshawar Zalmi. Lahore Qalandars won the match by 6 wickets.

## Final

The Final was played between the winner of the Qualifier, Multan Sultans, and the winner of Eliminator 2, Lahore Qalandars. Lahore Qalandars won the match by 42 runs.

# Awards and statistics

## Most runs

The top run-scorers in the 2022 Pakistan Super League were:

* Fakhar Zaman (Lahore Qalandars) - 585 runs
* Shan Masood (Multan Sultans) - 457 runs
* Mohammad Rizwan (Multan Sultans) - 443 runs

## Most wickets

The top wicket-takers in the 2022 Pakistan Super League were:

* Shaheen Afridi (Lahore Qalandars) - 20 wickets
* Shadab Khan (Islamabad United) - 19 wickets
* Imran Tahir (Multan Sultans) - 16 wickets

# Notes

The 2022 Pakistan Super League was the first edition of the tournament to be played entirely in Pakistan. The tournament was a huge success, with large crowds attending matches and high television ratings.

2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup

The 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup was the 15th edition of the Women's FIH Hockey World Cup, the premier international women's field hockey championship organized by the International Hockey Federation (FIH). The tournament was held from 1 to 17 July 2022 in Terrassa, Spain, and Amstelveen, Netherlands.

# Host selection

The FIH announced the host nations for the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup on November 8, 2019. Spain and the Netherlands were chosen as co-hosts, with the tournament being split between the cities of Terrassa and Amstelveen. This marked the second time that the Netherlands had hosted the Women's FIH Hockey World Cup, following the 1986 edition.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup consisted of several rounds, with teams competing in various continental and international tournaments to secure a spot in the final tournament. A total of 16 teams qualified for the World Cup, including the host nations, Spain and the Netherlands.

# Venues

The 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup was held in two venues: the Estadi Olímpic de Terrassa in Terrassa, Spain, and the Wagener Stadium in Amstelveen, Netherlands. Both venues have hosted several international hockey tournaments in the past, including the 1992 Summer Olympics and the 2003 Men's EuroHockey Nations Championship.

# Draw

The draw for the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup took place on April 17, 2022, in Terrassa, Spain. The 16 participating teams were divided into four pools of four teams each, with the teams in each pool competing in a round-robin format.

## Seeding

The teams were seeded based on their FIH World Rankings, with the top four teams in the rankings being placed in separate pools. The remaining teams were then drawn into the pools based on their ranking.

# Squads

Each participating team selected a squad of 18 players for the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup. The squads were announced by the respective national associations prior to the start of the tournament.

# Umpires

A total of 18 umpires were appointed by the FIH to officiate the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup. The umpires were selected based on their experience and performance in previous international tournaments.

# First round

The first round of the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup consisted of four pools, with the teams in each pool competing in a round-robin format. The top two teams from each pool advanced to the quarterfinals, while the remaining teams competed in the classification matches.

## Pool A

Pool A consisted of Argentina, China, Japan, and South Africa. Argentina and China topped the pool, advancing to the quarterfinals.

## Pool B

Pool B consisted of Australia, Belgium, Japan, and South Africa. Australia and Belgium topped the pool, advancing to the quarterfinals.

## Pool C

Pool C consisted of England, India, Malaysia, and Spain. England and Spain topped the pool, advancing to the quarterfinals.

## Pool D

Pool D consisted of Germany, Ireland, Italy, and the Netherlands. Germany and the Netherlands topped the pool, advancing to the quarterfinals.

# Classification

The classification matches were played between the teams that finished third and fourth in each pool. The matches were played in a knockout format, with the winners advancing to the next round.

## 9–16th place quarterfinals

The 9–16th place quarterfinals were played between the teams that finished third and fourth in each pool. The winners advanced to the 9–12th place classification matches.

## 13–16th place classification

The 13–16th place classification matches were played between the teams that lost in the 9–16th place quarterfinals. The winners finished 13th and 14th, while the losers finished 15th and 16th.

## 9–12th place classification

The 9–12th place classification matches were played between the winners of the 9–16th place quarterfinals. The winners finished 9th and 10th, while the losers finished 11th and 12th.

# Second round

The second round of the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup consisted of the quarterfinals, semifinals, and final.

## Bracket

The quarterfinals were played between the top two teams from each pool. The winners advanced to the semifinals, while the losers competed in the third place match.

## Cross-overs

The cross-over matches were played between the teams that finished third and fourth in each pool. The winners advanced to the quarterfinals, while the losers competed in the classification matches.

## Quarter-finals

The quarterfinals were played between the top two teams from each pool. The winners advanced to the semifinals, while the losers competed in the third place match.

## Semi-finals

The semifinals were played between the winners of the quarterfinals. The winners advanced to the final, while the losers competed in the third place match.

## Third place match

The third place match was played between the losers of the semifinals. The winner finished third, while the loser finished fourth.

The final was played between the winners of the semifinals. The winner was crowned the champion of the 2022 Women's FIH Hockey World Cup.

article:
The Flash Season 9

The ninth and final season of the American superhero television series The Flash premiered in 2023 on The CW. The season follows Barry Allen, a crime scene investigator who gains the ability to move at superhuman speeds, as he protects Central City from various villains and threats.

# Episodes

The ninth season of The Flash consists of 13 episodes, each with a unique storyline while contributing to the overall narrative of the season. The episodes are:

1. "Wednesday Ever After"
2. "Unmasked"
3. "Rogues of War"
4. "The Mask of the Red Death, Part 1"
5. "The Mask of the Red Death, Part 2"
6. "Rebirth"
7. "Wildest Dreams"
8. "Partners in Time"
9. "It's My Party and I'll Die If I Want To"
10. "The Good, the Bad, and the Lucky"
11. "The Last Temptation of Barry Allen"
12. "Whose Side Are You On?"
13. "A New World, Part 4 - Finale"

# Cast and characters

The main cast of The Flash season 9 includes:

* Grant Gustin as Barry Allen / The Flash
* Candice Patton as Iris West-Allen
* Danielle Panabaker as Caitlin Snow / Killer Frost
* Danielle Nicolet as Cecile Horton
* Kayla Compton as Allegra Garcia
* Brandon McKnight as Chester P. Runk
* Jon Cor as Mark Blaine / Chillblaine

## Guest

Several actors reprise their roles as guest stars in season 9, including:

* Tom Cavanagh as Eobard Thawne
* Rick Cosnett as Eddie Thawne
* Robbie Amell as Ronnie Raymond
* Wentworth Miller as Leonard Snart / Captain Cold
* Victor Garber as Martin Stein
* Franz Drameh as Jefferson "Jax" Jackson
* Maisie Richardson-Sellers as Amaya Jiwe / Vixen
* Matt Letscher as Eobard Thawne / Reverse-Flash

# Production

## Development

The ninth season of The Flash was announced in March 2022, with Grant Gustin set to reprise his role as Barry Allen. The season is the final chapter in the Arrowverse, following the conclusion of Arrow, Supergirl, and Legends of Tomorrow.

## Writing

The writing team for season 9 includes Eric Wallace, Sam Chalsen, and Kristen Kim. The season's narrative is designed to conclude the storylines of the main characters while introducing new villains and plot twists.

## Casting

In addition to the returning cast members, several new actors were cast in recurring roles for season 9. These include Javicia Leslie as Red Death, a villain from the Batman comics, and Richard Harmon as Owen Mercer, a character from the Arrowverse.

## Filming

Filming for season 9 began in July 2022 and concluded in March 2023. The season was shot on location in Vancouver, British Columbia, with some scenes filmed in Los Angeles.

# Release

The ninth season of The Flash premiered on February 8, 2023, on The CW. The season aired on Wednesday nights at 8:00 pm ET, with each episode available to stream on The CW app and website the following day.

# Notes

The ninth season of The Flash features several nods to previous seasons and Arrowverse shows, including the return of several characters and the use of iconic locations and plot devices.

article:
Economics of Open Science

The economics of open science refers to the study of the production, distribution, and consumption of scientific knowledge in an open and collaborative environment. Open science is a movement that seeks to make scientific research, data, and dissemination accessible to all, with the aim of accelerating scientific progress and improving societal outcomes. The economics of open science is a multidisciplinary field that draws on concepts from economics, sociology, and science studies to understand the economic implications of open science.

# Economic models

Economic models are essential for understanding the economics of open science. These models provide a framework for analyzing the production, distribution, and consumption of scientific knowledge in an open science environment.

## Open science club

The concept of an open science club is central to the economics of open science. An open science club is a group of individuals or organizations that share a common goal of advancing scientific knowledge through open and collaborative research.

### Definitions of knowledge club

A knowledge club is a group of individuals or organizations that share knowledge and expertise in a particular field. Knowledge clubs can be formal or informal and can take many different forms, including research networks, collaborations, and consortia.

### Knowledge club and open science

In the context of open science, a knowledge club is a group of researchers who share a common goal of advancing scientific knowledge through open and collaborative research. Open science clubs can take many different forms, including online communities, research networks, and collaborations.

## Open Science market

The open science market refers to the market for scientific research, data, and dissemination in an open science environment. The open science market is characterized by a number of distinct features, including a hybrid market structure, diversification of revenue streams, and a shift from readers to authors.

### Scientific publishing: a hybrid market

The scientific publishing market is a hybrid market, meaning that it combines elements of both public and private goods. Scientific research is a public good, as it is non-rivalrous and non-excludable, but the dissemination of research results through publishing is a private good, as it is excludable and rivalrous.

### From readers to authors: hybrid and full open access

The open science movement has led to a shift from readers to authors in the scientific publishing market. Hybrid open access models, which allow authors to pay for open access to their articles, have become increasingly popular, as have full open access models, which make all research articles openly available.

### From publishing to analytics: diversification of revenue streams

The open science market has also seen a diversification of revenue streams, as publishers and other stakeholders seek to capitalize on the growing demand for open science. Analytics and data services have become increasingly important, as researchers seek to make sense of the growing volume of scientific data.

## Open Science Commons

The open science commons refers to the shared knowledge and resources that are available to all in an open science environment. The open science commons is characterized by a number of distinct features, including the emergence of digital knowledge commons, enclosures of open science commons, and consolidation of the common ecosystem.

### The emergence of digital knowledge commons

The emergence of digital technologies has led to the creation of new forms of knowledge commons, including online repositories, data archives, and collaboration platforms. These digital knowledge commons have made it possible for researchers to share knowledge and resources on a global scale.

### Enclosures of open science commons

Despite the growth of the open science commons, there are also efforts to enclose and restrict access to scientific knowledge. Patents, copyrights, and other forms of intellectual property protection can limit access to scientific knowledge and create barriers to collaboration.

### Consolidation of the common ecosystem (2015-)

In recent years, there has been a trend towards consolidation of the open science ecosystem, as large corporations and other stakeholders seek to capitalize on the growing demand for open science. This consolidation has raised concerns about the future of the open science movement and the potential for unequal access to scientific knowledge.

# Cost

The cost of open science is a critical issue, as researchers and institutions seek to make scientific knowledge more widely available. There are a number of different costs associated with open science, including editorial work and evaluation, technical infrastructure, and commercial services and prestige.

## Editorial work and evaluation

Editorial work and evaluation are essential components of the scientific publishing process, but they can be time-consuming and costly. Open science models often rely on volunteer editors and peer reviewers, which can help to reduce costs.

## Technical infrastructure

The technical infrastructure required to support open science can be significant, including servers, software, and other equipment. However, the cost of technical infrastructure can be reduced through the use of cloud computing and other digital technologies.

## Commercial services and prestige

Commercial services, such as publishing and data analytics, can be an important source of revenue for open science initiatives. However, the pursuit of prestige and reputation can also drive up costs, as researchers and institutions seek to establish themselves as leaders in their fields.

# Benefits

The benefits of open science are numerous, including reduced transaction costs, access costs, and increased research efficiency. Open science can also contribute to economic and social development, as scientific knowledge is made more widely available.

## Transaction costs

Open science can reduce transaction costs, as researchers and institutions are able to share knowledge and resources more easily. This can lead to increased collaboration and innovation, as well as reduced costs for publication and dissemination.

## Access costs

Open science can also reduce access costs, as scientific knowledge is made more widely available. This can be particularly beneficial for researchers in developing countries, who may not have access to expensive journals and databases.

## Research efficiency

Open science can increase research efficiency, as researchers are able to build on each other's work more easily. This can lead to faster breakthroughs and discoveries, as well as increased productivity.

## Economic and social development

Open science can contribute to economic and social development, as scientific knowledge is made more widely available. This can lead to increased innovation and entrepreneurship, as well as improved health and well-being.

# Economic regulation of open science

Economic regulation of open science is an important issue, as governments and other stakeholders seek to promote open science while also protecting intellectual property and other economic interests. There are a number of different regulatory approaches, including open access mandates, funding for open science initiatives, and tax incentives for open science research.

In conclusion, the economics of open science is a complex and multifaceted field, with a number of different economic models, costs, benefits, and regulatory approaches. As the open science movement continues to grow and evolve, it is essential to understand the economic implications of open science and to develop policies and practices that promote openness, collaboration, and innovation.

article:
Pelé
================

Edson Arantes do Nascimento, known worldwide as Pelé, was a Brazilian professional footballer who played as a forward for Santos FC and the Brazil national team. Regarded by many as the greatest player of all time, Pelé is a three-time World Cup winner and scored over 1000 goals in his career.

Early years
------------

Pelé was born on October 23, 1940, in Três Corações, Minas Gerais, Brazil. He grew up in a humble household with his parents, João Ramos do Nascimento and Dona Celeste Arantes, and his younger brother, Jair. Pelé's early life was marked by poverty, and he had to work as a street sweeper and a shoe shiner to support his family.

Pelé's introduction to football came at the age of 8, when he started playing with his friends in the streets of Três Corações. He quickly fell in love with the sport and began to play for a local team called Bauru Athletic Club.

Club career
------------

### Santos

#### 1956–1962: early years with Santos and declared a national treasure

In 1956, Pelé moved to Santos, São Paulo, to join Santos FC, one of the most successful clubs in Brazil. He quickly established himself as a key player for the team, scoring 58 goals in his first season. In 1958, Pelé helped Santos win the São Paulo State Championship, and in 1960, he scored 47 goals in 30 games, helping the team win the same championship again.

In 1961, Pelé was declared a national treasure by the Brazilian government, which meant that he was prohibited from being transferred to any foreign club. This move was made to ensure that Pelé remained in Brazil and continued to play for Santos.

#### 1962–1965: Copa Libertadores success

In 1962, Pelé helped Santos win the Copa Libertadores, South America's most prestigious club competition. He scored 5 goals in the tournament, including 2 in the final against Benfica. In 1963, Pelé scored 14 goals in 10 games, helping Santos win the Copa Libertadores again.

#### 1965–1974: O Milésimo and final years with Santos

In 1965, Pelé scored his 1000th goal, which became known as O Milésimo (The Thousandth). He continued to play for Santos until 1974, when he retired from professional football.

### Tours with Santos

During his time with Santos, Pelé went on several tours with the team, playing exhibition matches in Europe, Africa, and Asia. These tours helped to establish Pelé as a global football superstar.

### New York Cosmos

In 1975, Pelé came out of retirement to play for the New York Cosmos, a team in the North American Soccer League (NASL). He played for the Cosmos for 3 seasons, helping the team win the NASL championship in 1977.

International career
-------------------

### 1958 World Cup

Pelé made his international debut for Brazil in 1957, at the age of 17. He was selected for the 1958 World Cup in Sweden, where he scored 6 goals, including 2 in the final against Sweden. Brazil won the tournament, and Pelé was hailed as a hero in Brazil.

### 1959 South American Championship

In 1959, Pelé helped Brazil win the South American Championship, scoring 8 goals in 6 games.

### 1962 World Cup

Pelé was injured in the 1962 World Cup in Chile, but he still managed to score 1 goal in the tournament. Brazil won the tournament again, but Pelé's injury limited his playing time.

### 1966 World Cup

Pelé was once again injured in the 1966 World Cup in England, but he still managed to score 1 goal in the tournament. Brazil was eliminated in the group stage, and Pelé was criticized for his performance.

### 1970 World Cup

Pelé played in the 1970 World Cup in Mexico, where he scored 4 goals in 6 games. Brazil won the tournament, and Pelé was hailed as a hero again.

Style of play
-------------

Pelé was known for his speed, skill, and scoring ability. He was a versatile player who could play anywhere on the field, but he was most effective as a forward. Pelé's playing style was characterized by his quick movements, precise passing, and powerful shooting.

Legacy
--------

Pelé's legacy extends far beyond his playing career. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, and his influence on the sport of football is still felt today.

### Accolades

Pelé has received numerous accolades throughout his career, including:

* 3 World Cup titles
* 2 Copa Libertadores titles
* 6 São Paulo State Championships
* 1 NASL championship
* FIFA Player of the Century
* Ballon d'Or (1977)

### "Pelé Pact" and Puma sponsorship

In 1970, Pelé signed a sponsorship deal with Puma, which became known as the "Pelé Pact". The deal made Pelé one of the first athletes to endorse a sports brand.

Personal life
-------------

### Relationships and children

Pelé has been married three times and has seven children. His first marriage was to Rosemeri dos Reis Cholbi, with whom he had two daughters, Kelly Cristina and Jennifer. His second marriage was to Assíria Lemos Seixas, with whom he had two sons, Joshua and Jordan. His third marriage was to Xuxa Meneghel, with whom he had a son, Joshua.

### Politics

Pelé has been involved in politics throughout his life. In 1994, he was appointed as the Minister of Sport in Brazil, a position he held until 1998. In 2004, he was appointed as the UNESCO Goodwill Ambassador.

### Religion

Pelé is a devout Catholic and has been involved in various charitable initiatives throughout his life.

### Health

Pelé has struggled with health issues throughout his life, including a knee injury that forced him to retire from professional football. In 2020, he underwent surgery to remove a tumor from his colon.

After football
--------------

After retiring from professional football, Pelé continued to be involved in the sport. He worked as a coach and a commentator, and he was involved in various charitable initiatives.

Death and funeral
-----------------

Pelé passed away on December 29, 2022, at the age of 82, after a long battle with cancer. His funeral was held in Santos, Brazil, and he was laid to rest in the Santos FC cemetery.

64th Annual Grammy Awards

The 64th Annual Grammy Awards, honoring the best in music for the year 2021, were held on April 3, 2022, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The ceremony was originally scheduled for January 31, 2022, but was postponed due to concerns over the COVID-19 pandemic. The event was hosted by Trevor Noah, marking his second consecutive year as host.

# Background

## Category changes

The Recording Academy announced several changes to the award categories for the 64th Annual Grammy Awards. The number of categories was reduced from 84 to 78, with some categories being merged or eliminated. The changes were made to reflect the evolving music industry and to improve the voting process.

## Nomination changes

The nomination process was also modified, with the number of nominees in each category increasing from five to ten. This change was made to provide more opportunities for artists to be recognized and to reflect the diversity of the music industry.

## Voting changes

The voting process was also changed, with the addition of a new voting system. The system, known as the "peer-based" voting system, allows voters to select their top choices in each category, rather than ranking their choices.

## Nomination withdrawals

Several artists withdrew their nominations from consideration, citing concerns over the voting process and the lack of diversity among the nominees. The withdrawals were made in an effort to bring attention to the issues and to promote change within the industry.

## Postponement and relocation

The ceremony was originally scheduled for January 31, 2022, but was postponed due to concerns over the COVID-19 pandemic. The event was later relocated from the Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles to the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada.

# Performers

article:
Karl R. Free

Karl R. Free was an American artist, best known for his work on post office murals in the 1930s. As an assistant curator at the Whitney Museum, Free played a significant role in promoting American art and artists. His post office murals, commissioned by the Treasury Department's Section of Fine Arts, were intended to bring art to the masses and showcase American culture. However, some of his works were met with controversy and objections, reflecting the complexities of artistic expression and community values.

#Early years

Karl R. Free was born in the late 19th century, and his early life and education are not well-documented. However, it is known that he developed an interest in art at an early age and pursued a career in the field. Free's early work was likely influenced by the artistic movements of the time, including American Regionalism and Social Realism. These styles emphasized the importance of depicting everyday American life and the experiences of ordinary people.

#Whitney Museum assistant curator

In the 1920s and 1930s, Free worked as an assistant curator at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York City. During his tenure, the museum focused on promoting American art and artists, with a particular emphasis on modern and contemporary works. As an assistant curator, Free was responsible for organizing exhibitions, acquiring new works for the museum's collection, and supporting emerging artists.

Free's work at the Whitney Museum helped to establish him as a prominent figure in the American art world. His expertise and connections likely played a role in his later selection as a post office mural artist.

#Post office murals

In the 1930s, the Treasury Department's Section of Fine Arts commissioned Karl R. Free to create murals for post offices in Washington, D.C. and Princeton, New Jersey. These works were part of a larger effort to bring art to the masses and decorate public buildings.

##Washington, D.C.

###Creation

Free's mural for the Washington, D.C. post office, titled "The History of the Mail," depicted scenes from the history of the postal service. The work featured prominent figures, including Benjamin Franklin and George Washington, as well as everyday Americans engaged in postal activities. The mural was intended to celebrate the importance of the postal service in American life.

###Reception and objections

While "The History of the Mail" was widely praised for its artistic merit, some viewers objected to the depiction of African Americans in the mural. The work included a small image of a slave delivering mail, which some saw as perpetuating negative stereotypes. Others felt that the mural did not adequately represent the contributions of African Americans to the postal service.

##Princeton, New Jersey

###Creation

Free's mural for the Princeton, New Jersey post office, titled "The Industries of Princeton," showcased the town's economic and cultural activities. The work featured scenes of Princeton's famous university, as well as its manufacturing and agricultural industries.

###Reception and objections

"The Industries of Princeton" was met with controversy over its depiction of the town's African American community. Some viewers felt that the mural perpetuated stereotypes and did not accurately represent the experiences of African Americans in Princeton. Others objected to the inclusion of a scene showing a Princeton University professor lecturing to a group of African American students, which some saw as condescending.

#1939 and beyond

Karl R. Free's work on post office murals ended in the late 1930s, as the Treasury Department's Section of Fine Arts was disbanded. Free's later life and artistic career are not well-documented, and it is unclear whether he continued to work as an artist.

article:
Chandrayaan-3

Chandrayaan-3 is a lunar exploration mission developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO). The mission is a follow-up to the Chandrayaan-2 mission, which aimed to demonstrate the ability to soft-land on the lunar surface but unfortunately failed to do so. Chandrayaan-3 aims to achieve this goal and expand on the scientific objectives of its predecessor. The mission is a significant milestone in India's space program, marking the country's second attempt at a soft lunar landing.

# History

Chandrayaan-3 was first proposed in 2019, shortly after the failure of the Chandrayaan-2 mission. The ISRO quickly began working on a new mission, incorporating lessons learned from the previous attempt. The spacecraft design and development process were accelerated, with a focus on achieving a successful soft landing on the lunar surface.

# Objectives

The primary objectives of the Chandrayaan-3 mission are:

* To demonstrate the ability to soft-land on the lunar surface
* To conduct scientific experiments on the lunar surface
* To expand on the understanding of the lunar geology, composition, and atmosphere
* To test new technologies and strategies for future lunar missions

# Spacecraft

The Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft consists of three main components: the Propulsion Module, the Vikram lander, and the Pragyan rover.

## Design

The spacecraft design is based on the Chandrayaan-2 mission, with several modifications and improvements.

### Propulsion Module

The Propulsion Module is the main spacecraft component, responsible for propelling the lander and rover to the lunar surface. It is equipped with a liquid-fueled engine and a navigation system.

### Vikram Lander

The Vikram lander is a separate module that separates from the Propulsion Module and descends to the lunar surface. It is equipped with a retro-propulsion system, a navigation system, and a communication system.

### Rover Pragyan

The Pragyan rover is a small, six-wheeled robotic vehicle that is carried by the Vikram lander to the lunar surface. It is equipped with a suite of scientific instruments, including cameras, spectrometers, and a seismometer.

## Payloads

The Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft carries a range of scientific payloads, including instruments on the lander, rover, and Propulsion Module.

### On Lander

The Vikram lander carries several scientific instruments, including:

* A Langmuir probe to study the lunar plasma
* A Seismometer to study lunar seismic activity
* A Laser Ranging Retroreflector to measure the distance between the Earth and the Moon

### On Rover

The Pragyan rover carries several scientific instruments, including:

* A Alpha Particle X-Ray Spectrometer to study the lunar surface composition
* A Laser-Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy instrument to study the lunar surface composition
* A Seismometer to study lunar seismic activity

### On the Propulsion Module

The Propulsion Module carries several scientific instruments, including:

* A High-Resolution Camera to study the lunar surface
* A Spectrometer to study the lunar surface composition
* A Radar Altimeter to study the lunar surface topography

# Mission Profile

## Launch

The Chandrayaan-3 mission was launched on July 14, 2023, at 09:05 UTC from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota, India.

## Orbit

After launch, the spacecraft entered a highly elliptical Earth orbit, with a perigee of 170 km and an apogee of 36,000 km.

## Landing

The Vikram lander separated from the Propulsion Module and descended to the lunar surface on August 23, 2023. The landing site was located in the lunar south pole, near the Shackleton crater.

## Surface Operations

The Pragyan rover was deployed from the Vikram lander and began its scientific experiments on the lunar surface. The rover conducted a range of experiments, including studying the lunar surface composition, geology, and atmospheric conditions.

## Propulsion Module Reinserted to Orbit Around Earth

After the landing, the Propulsion Module was reinserted into a highly elliptical Earth orbit, with a perigee of 170 km and an apogee of 36,000 km.

## Mission Life

The Chandrayaan-3 mission is designed to last for 14 days, with the lander and rover operating on the lunar surface for 14 days. The Propulsion Module will continue to operate in Earth orbit for several months, conducting scientific experiments and testing new technologies.

# Team

The Chandrayaan-3 mission is led by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), with a team of scientists and engineers from across India.

# Funding

The Chandrayaan-3 mission is funded by the Government of India, with a budget of approximately ₹6 billion (US$83 million).

# Results

The Chandrayaan-3 mission has achieved several significant results, including:

## Temperature Variation

The Pragyan rover has measured the temperature variation on the lunar surface, finding that the temperature ranges from -173°C to 127°C.

## Detection of Sulfur

The Alpha Particle X-Ray Spectrometer on the Pragyan rover has detected the presence of sulfur on the lunar surface.

## Plasma Measurement

The Langmuir probe on the Vikram lander has measured the plasma conditions on the lunar surface, providing insights into the lunar exosphere.

## Seismic Measurements

The Seismometer on the Pragyan rover has measured the seismic activity on the lunar surface, providing insights into the lunar interior structure.

# Domestic Reactions

The Chandrayaan-3 mission has received widespread acclaim in India, with the government and media hailing it as a major achievement.

# International Reactions

The international community has also welcomed the Chandrayaan-3 mission, with NASA and other space agencies congratulating ISRO on its success.

# Awards

The Chandrayaan-3 mission has received several awards, including the prestigious Aryabhata Award.

This article is based on publicly available information and does not include any confidential or proprietary information.

# References

article:
Sandy Koufax

Sanford "Sandy" Koufax is a retired American baseball player who played his entire career as a pitcher for the Los Angeles Dodgers (1955-1966). Koufax is widely regarded as one of the greatest pitchers in baseball history, known for his blazing fastball, sharp curveball, and pinpoint control. He is a three-time Cy Young Award winner, four-time World Series champion, and seven-time All-Star.

#Early life

Sandy Koufax was born on December 30, 1935, in Brooklyn, New York, to Evelyn and Jack Koufax. His father was an attorney who later became a successful businessman. Koufax grew up in a Jewish family and was raised in the Borough Park section of Brooklyn. He developed an interest in sports at an early age and played basketball and baseball in high school.

##Major League tryouts

After graduating from Lafayette High School in 1953, Koufax attended the University of Cincinnati on a basketball scholarship. However, he soon dropped out of college to pursue a career in baseball. In 1954, Koufax tried out for the New York Giants, but was not offered a contract. He then tried out for the Pittsburgh Pirates, but was again unsuccessful. Koufax's big break came when he was spotted by Al Campanis, a scout for the Brooklyn Dodgers, who signed him to a contract in 1954.

#Professional career

##Early years (1955–1960)

Koufax made his major league debut on June 24, 1955, for the Brooklyn Dodgers. He struggled in his early years, posting a 42-53 record with a 4.10 ERA. Despite his struggles, Koufax showed flashes of brilliance, striking out 262 batters in 1959.

##Domination (1961–1964)

###1961 season

In 1961, Koufax's career took a dramatic turn. He went 18-13 with a 3.09 ERA, striking out 269 batters. Koufax's performance earned him his first All-Star selection and a fourth-place finish in the Cy Young Award voting.

###1962 season

Koufax continued to dominate in 1962, going 14-7 with a 2.54 ERA. He struck out 216 batters and was named to his second All-Star team.

###1963 season

In 1963, Koufax had his best season to date, going 25-5 with a 1.88 ERA. He struck out 306 batters and was named the National League Cy Young Award winner.

##Salary dispute

###1964 season

Koufax's salary dispute with the Dodgers made headlines in 1964. Koufax, who was making $35,000, demanded a significant raise. The Dodgers offered him a $50,000 contract, but Koufax held out for more. He eventually signed a one-year deal worth $75,000.

##Playing in pain (1965–66)

###1965 season

####Perfection

On September 9, 1965, Koufax pitched a perfect game against the Chicago Cubs, striking out 14 batters. It was the first perfect game in Dodgers history and the eighth in major league history.

####World Series and Yom Kippur decision

Koufax's decision to sit out Game 1 of the 1965 World Series against the Minnesota Twins on Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish calendar, made headlines. Koufax's decision was seen as a defining moment in his career and a testament to his commitment to his faith.

##Holdout

###1966 season

Koufax's salary dispute with the Dodgers continued in 1966. He held out for several weeks, eventually signing a one-year deal worth $125,000.

##Retirement

Koufax retired from baseball on November 18, 1966, at the age of 30, due to chronic arthritic pain in his left elbow. He finished his career with a 165-87 record, a 2.76 ERA, and 2,396 strikeouts.

#Career overall

##Statistics and achievements

Koufax's career statistics include a 165-87 record, a 2.76 ERA, and 2,396 strikeouts. He was a three-time Cy Young Award winner, four-time World Series champion, and seven-time All-Star.

##Pitching style and repertoire

Koufax was known for his blazing fastball, sharp curveball, and pinpoint control. He was a master of the strike zone, with a career strikeout-to-walk ratio of 3.97. Koufax's pitching style was characterized by his high leg kick and smooth delivery.

#Post-playing activities

After his retirement, Koufax went on to become a successful businessman and entrepreneur. He has been involved in various business ventures, including real estate and broadcasting.

#Honors and recognition

Koufax was inducted into the National Baseball Hall of Fame in 1972, at the age of 36. He was named the National League's Most Valuable Player in 1963 and was a three-time Cy Young Award winner.

#Legacy

##Impact within the Jewish community

Koufax's impact on the Jewish community cannot be overstated. He was a hero and a role model for Jewish kids growing up in the 1950s and 1960s. His decision to sit out Game 1 of the 1965 World Series on Yom Kippur was seen as a defining moment in his career and a testament to his commitment to his faith.

##Relationship with fellow minorities

Koufax was a close friend and mentor to Don Newcombe, the first African American player to win a Cy Young Award. Koufax was also a vocal supporter of the Civil Rights Movement, and he used his platform to speak out against racism and inequality.

#In media culture

##Television appearances

Koufax made several television appearances during his career, including a guest spot on the popular sitcom "The Dick Van Dyke Show."

##Cultural references

Koufax has been referenced in popular culture, including in films, literature, and music. He was the subject of a 1965 book, "Koufax," written by Milton Shapiro.

#Personal life

Koufax is married to Kimberly Koufax, and they have two children together. He is a private person and keeps a low profile, but he has been involved in various charitable endeavors, including the Jewish National Fund and the Sandy Koufax Foundation.

* Koufax's career strikeout-to-walk ratio of 3.97 is the highest in major league history.

SOS (SZA album)

SOS is the second studio album by American singer-songwriter SZA, released on December 9, 2022, through Top Dawg Entertainment and RCA Records. The album marks SZA's first solo release since her critically acclaimed debut Ctrl in 2017. SOS is a genre-bending album that explores themes of love, heartbreak, and self-discovery, featuring a diverse range of musical styles and collaborations.

#Background

SZA began working on SOS in 2019, shortly after the release of her debut album Ctrl. However, the album's production was delayed due to SZA's struggles with writer's block and her desire to experiment with new sounds. In a 2020 interview, SZA revealed that she had written over 100 songs for the album but was struggling to find a cohesive direction. Throughout 2020 and 2021, SZA continued to work on the album, collaborating with various producers and songwriters.

#Writing and production

SOS features production from a range of collaborators, including SZA herself, along with producers such as Carter Lang, Rob Bisel, and ThankGod4Cody. The album's writing process was highly collaborative, with SZA working closely with songwriters such as Lizzo, Ty Dolla Sign, and Phoebe Bridgers. In an interview, SZA revealed that she had written many of the album's songs in isolation, drawing inspiration from her personal experiences and emotions.

#Composition

Musically, SOS is a diverse and experimental album that blends elements of R&B, hip-hop, rock, and electronic music. The album features a range of instrumentation, including guitars, bass, and synthesizers, along with SZA's signature soulful vocals. Lyrically, the album explores themes of love, heartbreak, and self-discovery, with SZA delivering introspective and emotionally charged performances.

#Title and artwork

The title SOS is an acronym for "Sisters Only Squad," a phrase that SZA has used to describe her close-knit group of female friends and collaborators. The album's artwork features a photograph of SZA taken by actor and photographer, Michael B. Jordan. The image shows SZA posing in a red swimsuit, surrounded by water, and has been interpreted as a symbol of rebirth and transformation.

#Promotion

SOS was promoted through a series of singles and music videos, including "Good Days," "I Hate U," and "Nobody Gets Me." The album's release was also accompanied by a series of promotional events, including a live performance on Saturday Night Live and a concert at the iconic Madison Square Garden. SZA also embarked on a world tour in support of the album, performing to sold-out crowds across North America, Europe, and Australia.

#Critical reception

##Reviews

SOS received widespread critical acclaim upon its release, with many praising SZA's innovative production, introspective lyrics, and soaring vocals. Rolling Stone described the album as "a masterpiece of introspective R&B," while The New York Times praised SZA's "unflinching honesty" and " genre-bending" sound. Pitchfork awarded the album a perfect score, hailing it as "a triumphant, genre-defying album that cements SZA's status as one of the most innovative and compelling artists of her generation."

##Year-end rankings

SOS appeared on numerous year-end lists, including those of Rolling Stone, Pitchfork, and The New York Times. The album was also named one of the best albums of 2022 by publications such as Billboard, Complex, and NME.

#Awards

SOS earned SZA numerous award nominations, including several Grammy Awards. The album was nominated for Album of the Year, Best R&B Album, and Best Music Video for "Good Days." SZA also won several awards for her work on the album, including the BET Award for Album of the Year and the MTV Video Music Award for Best R&B Video.

#Commercial performance

SOS was a commercial success, debuting at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart and selling over 300,000 copies in its first week. The album also reached number one on the UK Albums Chart and the Australian Albums Chart, and has been certified platinum in several countries, including the US, UK, and Australia.
